We need to find the car's speed at t = 2 seconds. Speed is the rate of change of position with respect to time, which is the derivative of position with respect to time, or the slope of the position-time graph.
The graph is a straight line with a positive slope, indicating constant acceleration. At t = 0, the position is at 10 m (y-intercept). The line extends backward with a dashed line to t = -2.

conclusion: The equation of the line can be represented as x = mt + b, where m is the slope (speed) and b is the y-intercept. Here, b = 10.
